facts.code:
import pandas as pd

# Load the dataset
path = 'outputs/simple_iteration/thread_20250815_045642/dataset_selected.csv'
df = pd.read_csv(path)

# Extract relevant data
sensemaking_papers = df[df['Title'].str.contains('sensemaking', case=False, na=False)]
affiliations = sensemaking_papers['AuthorAffiliation'].str.split(';', expand=True).stack()

# Calculate the most common affiliations
common_affiliations = affiliations.value_counts().head(5)

# Print the results
print("### Begin of facts")
print("Most common author affiliations in sensemaking research:")
for affiliation, count in common_affiliations.items():
    print(f"{affiliation}: {count} papers")
print("### End of facts")

import pandas as pd

# Load the dataset
path = 'outputs/simple_iteration/thread_20250815_045642/dataset_selected.csv'

question.question: What are the most common author affiliations in the dataset and how do they relate to the evolution of research on sensemaking?

facts.code:
import pandas as pd

# Load the dataset
path = 'outputs/simple_iteration/thread_20250815_045642/dataset_selected.csv'
df = pd.read_csv(path)

# Extract relevant data
sensemaking_papers = df[df['Title'].str.contains('sensemaking', case=False, na=False)]
affiliations = sensemaking_papers['AuthorAffiliation'].str.split(';', expand=True).stack()

# Calculate the most common affiliations
common_affiliations = affiliations.value_counts().head(5)

# Print the results
print("### Begin of facts")
print("Most common author affiliations in sensemaking research:")
for affiliation, count in common_affiliations.items():
    print(f"{affiliation}: {count} papers")
print("### End of facts")

question.question: What are the most common author affiliations in the dataset and how do they relate to the evolution of research on sensemaking?

facts.code:
import pandas as pd

# Load the dataset
path = 'outputs/simple_iteration/thread_20250815_045642/dataset_selected.csv'
df = pd.read_csv(path)

# Extract relevant data
sensemaking_papers = df[df['Title'].str.contains('sensemaking', case=False, na=False)]
affiliations = sensemaking_papers['AuthorAffiliation'].str.split(';', expand=True).stack()

# Calculate the most common affiliations
common_affiliations = affiliations.value_counts().head(5)

# Print the results
print("### Begin of facts")
print("Most common author affiliations in sensemaking research:")
for affiliation, count in common_affiliations.items():
    print(f"{affiliation}: {count} papers")
print("### End of facts")

question.question: What are the trends in citation counts over time for papers on sensemaking, and how do these trends correlate with the involvement of major contributing institutions like Middlesex University and Virginia Tech?

facts.code:
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Load the dataset
df = pd.read_csv('outputs/simple_iteration/thread_20250815_045642/dataset_selected.csv')

# Filter papers related to sensemaking
df_sensemaking = df[df['AuthorKeywords'].str.contains('sensemaking', case=False, na=False)]

# Extract relevant columns
df_sensemaking = df_sensemaking[['Year', 'CitationCount_CrossRef', 'AuthorAffiliation']]

# Calculate average citation count per year
df_trends = df_sensemaking.groupby('Year')['CitationCount_CrossRef'].mean().reset_index()

# Filter papers from major institutions
institutions = ['Middlesex University', 'Virginia Tech']
df_institutions = df_sensemaking[df_sensemaking['AuthorAffiliation'].str.contains('|'.join(institutions), case=False, na=False)]

# Calculate average citation count per year for major institutions
df_institution_trends = df_institutions.groupby('Year')['CitationCount_CrossRef'].mean().reset_index()

# Plot the trends
plt.figure(figsize=(10, 6))
plt.plot(df_trends['Year'], df_trends['CitationCount_CrossRef'], label='Overall Sensemaking Papers', marker='o')
plt.plot(df_institution_trends['Year'], df_institution_trends['CitationCount_CrossRef'], label='Major Institutions', marker='x')
plt.title('Trends in Citation Counts for Sensemaking Papers')
plt.xlabel('Year')
plt.ylabel('Average Citation Count')
plt.legend()
plt.grid(True)
plt.show()

# Print facts
print("### Begin of facts")
print(f"Overall average citation count for sensemaking papers: {df_sensemaking['CitationCount_CrossRef'].mean():.2f}")
print(f"Average citation count for major institutions: {df_institutions['CitationCount_CrossRef'].mean():.2f}")
print("### End of facts")

question.question: What are the most common author affiliations in the dataset and how do they relate to the evolution of research on sensemaking?

facts.code:
import pandas as pd

# Load the dataset
path = 'outputs/simple_iteration/thread_20250815_045642/dataset_selected.csv'
df = pd.read_csv(path)

# Extract relevant data
sensemaking_papers = df[df['Title'].str.contains('sensemaking', case=False, na=False)]
affiliations = sensemaking_papers['AuthorAffiliation'].str.split(';', expand=True).stack()

# Calculate the most common affiliations
common_affiliations = affiliations.value_counts().head(5)

# Print the results
print("### Begin of facts")
print("Most common author affiliations in sensemaking research:")
for affiliation, count in common_affiliations.items():
    print(f"{affiliation}: {count} papers")
print("### End of facts")

question.question: What are the trends in citation counts over time for papers on sensemaking, and how do these trends correlate with the involvement of major contributing institutions like Middlesex University and Virginia Tech?

facts.code:
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Load the dataset
df = pd.read_csv('outputs/simple_iteration/thread_20250815_045642/dataset_selected.csv')

# Filter papers related to sensemaking
df_sensemaking = df[df['AuthorKeywords'].str.contains('sensemaking', case=False, na=False)]

# Extract relevant columns
df_sensemaking = df_sensemaking[['Year', 'CitationCount_CrossRef', 'AuthorAffiliation']]

# Calculate average citation count per year
df_trends = df_sensemaking.groupby('Year')['CitationCount_CrossRef'].mean().reset_index()

# Filter papers from major institutions
institutions = ['Middlesex University', 'Virginia Tech']
df_institutions = df_sensemaking[df_sensemaking['AuthorAffiliation'].str.contains('|'.join(institutions), case=False, na=False)]

# Calculate average citation count per year for major institutions
df_institution_trends = df_institutions.groupby('Year')['CitationCount_CrossRef'].mean().reset_index()

# Plot the trends
plt.figure(figsize=(10, 6))
plt.plot(df_trends['Year'], df_trends['CitationCount_CrossRef'], label='Overall Sensemaking Papers', marker='o')
plt.plot(df_institution_trends['Year'], df_institution_trends['CitationCount_CrossRef'], label='Major Institutions', marker='x')
plt.title('Trends in Citation Counts for Sensemaking Papers')
plt.xlabel('Year')
plt.ylabel('Average Citation Count')
plt.legend()
plt.grid(True)
plt.show()

# Print facts
print("### Begin of facts")
print(f"Overall average citation count for sensemaking papers: {df_sensemaking['CitationCount_CrossRef'].mean():.2f}")
print(f"Average citation count for major institutions: {df_institutions['CitationCount_CrossRef'].mean():.2f}")
print("### End of facts")

question.question: What are the most common author affiliations in the dataset and how do they relate to the evolution of research on sensemaking?

facts.code:
import pandas as pd

# Load the dataset
path = 'outputs/simple_iteration/thread_20250815_045642/dataset_selected.csv'
df = pd.read_csv(path)

# Extract relevant data
sensemaking_papers = df[df['Title'].str.contains('sensemaking', case=False, na=False)]
affiliations = sensemaking_papers['AuthorAffiliation'].str.split(';', expand=True).stack()

# Calculate the most common affiliations
common_affiliations = affiliations.value_counts().head(5)

# Print the results
print("### Begin of facts")
print("Most common author affiliations in sensemaking research:")
for affiliation, count in common_affiliations.items():
    print(f"{affiliation}: {count} papers")
print("### End of facts")

question.question: What are the trends in citation counts over time for papers on sensemaking, and how do these trends correlate with the involvement of major contributing institutions like Middlesex University and Virginia Tech?

facts.code:
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Load the dataset
df = pd.read_csv('outputs/simple_iteration/thread_20250815_045642/dataset_selected.csv')

# Filter papers related to sensemaking
df_sensemaking = df[df['AuthorKeywords'].str.contains('sensemaking', case=False, na=False)]

# Extract relevant columns
df_sensemaking = df_sensemaking[['Year', 'CitationCount_CrossRef', 'AuthorAffiliation']]

# Calculate average citation count per year
df_trends = df_sensemaking.groupby('Year')['CitationCount_CrossRef'].mean().reset_index()

# Filter papers from major institutions
institutions = ['Middlesex University', 'Virginia Tech']
df_institutions = df_sensemaking[df_sensemaking['AuthorAffiliation'].str.contains('|'.join(institutions), case=False, na=False)]

# Calculate average citation count per year for major institutions
df_institution_trends = df_institutions.groupby('Year')['CitationCount_CrossRef'].mean().reset_index()

# Plot the trends
plt.figure(figsize=(10, 6))
plt.plot(df_trends['Year'], df_trends['CitationCount_CrossRef'], label='Overall Sensemaking Papers', marker='o')
plt.plot(df_institution_trends['Year'], df_institution_trends['CitationCount_CrossRef'], label='Major Institutions', marker='x')
plt.title('Trends in Citation Counts for Sensemaking Papers')
plt.xlabel('Year')
plt.ylabel('Average Citation Count')
plt.legend()
plt.grid(True)
plt.show()

# Print facts
print("### Begin of facts")
print(f"Overall average citation count for sensemaking papers: {df_sensemaking['CitationCount_CrossRef'].mean():.2f}")
print(f"Average citation count for major institutions: {df_institutions['CitationCount_CrossRef'].mean():.2f}")
print("### End of facts")

question.question: What are the most common author affiliations in the dataset and how do they relate to the evolution of research on sensemaking?

facts.code:
import pandas as pd

# Load the dataset
path = 'outputs/simple_iteration/thread_20250815_045642/dataset_selected.csv'
df = pd.read_csv(path)

# Extract relevant data
sensemaking_papers = df[df['Title'].str.contains('sensemaking', case=False, na=False)]
affiliations = sensemaking_papers['AuthorAffiliation'].str.split(';', expand=True).stack()

# Calculate the most common affiliations
common_affiliations = affiliations.value_counts().head(5)

# Print the results
print("### Begin of facts")
print("Most common author affiliations in sensemaking research:")
for affiliation, count in common_affiliations.items():
    print(f"{affiliation}: {count} papers")
print("### End of facts")

question.question: What are the trends in citation counts over time for papers on sensemaking, and how do these trends correlate with the involvement of major contributing institutions like Middlesex University and Virginia Tech?

facts.code:
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Load the dataset
df = pd.read_csv('outputs/simple_iteration/thread_20250815_045642/dataset_selected.csv')

# Filter papers related to sensemaking
df_sensemaking = df[df['AuthorKeywords'].str.contains('sensemaking', case=False, na=False)]

# Extract relevant columns
df_sensemaking = df_sensemaking[['Year', 'CitationCount_CrossRef', 'AuthorAffiliation']]

# Calculate average citation count per year
df_trends = df_sensemaking.groupby('Year')['CitationCount_CrossRef'].mean().reset_index()

# Filter papers from major institutions
institutions = ['Middlesex University', 'Virginia Tech']
df_institutions = df_sensemaking[df_sensemaking['AuthorAffiliation'].str.contains('|'.join(institutions), case=False, na=False)]

# Calculate average citation count per year for major institutions
df_institution_trends = df_institutions.groupby('Year')['CitationCount_CrossRef'].mean().reset_index()

# Plot the trends
plt.figure(figsize=(10, 6))
plt.plot(df_trends['Year'], df_trends['CitationCount_CrossRef'], label='Overall Sensemaking Papers', marker='o')
plt.plot(df_institution_trends['Year'], df_institution_trends['CitationCount_CrossRef'], label='Major Institutions', marker='x')
plt.title('Trends in Citation Counts for Sensemaking Papers')
plt.xlabel('Year')
plt.ylabel('Average Citation Count')
plt.legend()
plt.grid(True)
plt.show()

# Print facts
print("### Begin of facts")
print(f"Overall average citation count for sensemaking papers: {df_sensemaking['CitationCount_CrossRef'].mean():.2f}")
print(f"Average citation count for major institutions: {df_institutions['CitationCount_CrossRef'].mean():.2f}")
print("### End of facts")

question.question: What are the most common author affiliations in the dataset and how do they relate to the evolution of research on sensemaking?

facts.code:
import pandas as pd

# Load the dataset
path = 'outputs/simple_iteration/thread_20250815_045642/dataset_selected.csv'
df = pd.read_csv(path)

# Extract relevant data
sensemaking_papers = df[df['Title'].str.contains('sensemaking', case=False, na=False)]
affiliations = sensemaking_papers['AuthorAffiliation'].str.split(';', expand=True).stack()

# Calculate the most common affiliations
common_affiliations = affiliations.value_counts().head(5)

# Print the results
print("### Begin of facts")
print("Most common author affiliations in sensemaking research:")
for affiliation, count in common_affiliations.items():
    print(f"{affiliation}: {count} papers")
print("### End of facts")

question.question: What are the trends in citation counts over time for papers on sensemaking, and how do these trends correlate with the involvement of major contributing institutions like Middlesex University and Virginia Tech?

facts.code:
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Load the dataset
df = pd.read_csv('outputs/simple_iteration/thread_20250815_045642/dataset_selected.csv')

# Filter papers related to sensemaking
df_sensemaking = df[df['AuthorKeywords'].str.contains('sensemaking', case=False, na=False)]

# Extract relevant columns
df_sensemaking = df_sensemaking[['Year', 'CitationCount_CrossRef', 'AuthorAffiliation']]

# Calculate average citation count per year
df_trends = df_sensemaking.groupby('Year')['CitationCount_CrossRef'].mean().reset_index()

# Filter papers from major institutions
institutions = ['Middlesex University', 'Virginia Tech']
df_institutions = df_sensemaking[df_sensemaking['AuthorAffiliation'].str.contains('|'.join(institutions), case=False, na=False)]

# Calculate average citation count per year for major institutions
df_institution_trends = df_institutions.groupby('Year')['CitationCount_CrossRef'].mean().reset_index()

# Plot the trends
plt.figure(figsize=(10, 6))
plt.plot(df_trends['Year'], df_trends['CitationCount_CrossRef'], label='Overall Sensemaking Papers', marker='o')
plt.plot(df_institution_trends['Year'], df_institution_trends['CitationCount_CrossRef'], label='Major Institutions', marker='x')
plt.title('Trends in Citation Counts for Sensemaking Papers')
plt.xlabel('Year')
plt.ylabel('Average Citation Count')
plt.legend()
plt.grid(True)
plt.show()

# Print facts
print("### Begin of facts")
print(f"Overall average citation count for sensemaking papers: {df_sensemaking['CitationCount_CrossRef'].mean():.2f}")
print(f"Average citation count for major institutions: {df_institutions['CitationCount_CrossRef'].mean():.2f}")
print("### End of facts")
